intro: Casearia mariquitensis, commonly known as the Philippine casearia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small white flowers. It produces small, red berries that are edible but not commonly consumed by humans. Casearia mariquitensis is often found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments.
